com.agenarisk.api.model.interfaces

Interface Networked<N extends Networked>

  • Type Parameters:
    N - specific class implementing Networked, e.g. Network or Node
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Network, Node

    public interface Networked<N extends Networked>
    An interface for objects that can be connected into a network of objects (e.g. Nodes can be connected within a Network, or Networks can be connected within a Model).
    Author:
    Eugene Dementiev

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<N> getChildren()
      Builds and returns a set of children, which is valid at the time of request.
      List<Link> getLinksIn()
      Returns a copy of the list of incoming Links.
      List<Link> getLinksOut()
      Returns a copy of the list of outgoing Links.
      Set<N> getParents()
      Builds and returns a set of parents, which is valid at the time of request.
      default boolean hasAncestor(N ancestor)
      Checks recursively whether any of the links are incoming from the provided ancestor.
      default boolean hasDescendant(N descendant)
      Checks recursively whether any of the links are outgoing to the provided descendant.
      boolean unlink(N networked)
      Breaks the Link between this Networked object and the one provided, regardless of which one is the parent and which is the child.

    • Method Detail

      • hasAncestor

        default boolean hasAncestor(N ancestor)
        Checks recursively whether any of the links are incoming from the provided ancestor.
        Parameters:
        ancestor - ancestor object to look for
        Returns:
        true if ancestor is direct parent or a recursive ancestor

      • hasDescendant

        default boolean hasDescendant(N descendant)
        Checks recursively whether any of the links are outgoing to the provided descendant.
        Parameters:
        descendant - descendant object to look for
        Returns:
        true if descendant is direct child or a recursive descendant

      • getParents

        Set<N> getParents()
        Builds and returns a set of parents, which is valid at the time of request. This set will not reflect any membership changes made afterwards.
        Returns:
        a set of Networked parents

      • getChildren

        Set<N> getChildren()
        Builds and returns a set of children, which is valid at the time of request. This set will not reflect any membership changes made afterwards.
        Returns:
        a set of Networked children

      • getLinksIn

        List<Link> getLinksIn()
        Returns a copy of the list of incoming Links. The membership is only guaranteed to be valid at the time of request and is not maintained.
        Returns:
        list of incoming Links

      • getLinksOut

        List<Link> getLinksOut()
        Returns a copy of the list of outgoing Links. The membership is only guaranteed to be valid at the time of request and is not maintained.
        Returns:
        list of outgoing Links

      • unlink

        boolean unlink(N networked)
        Breaks the Link between this Networked object and the one provided, regardless of which one is the parent and which is the child.
        Parameters:
        networked - the Networked object to break a link with
        Returns:
        true if the Link was actually removed and false if there was no such Link to begin with
